question.title: Scalable and generic way to store and display massive reports with dynamic columns (Java + MySQL)
question.body:
I’m working on a Grails 5 app (Java 11, MySQL 5.7, Redis) and I’m trying to come up with a solid and generic solution for handling large, dynamic reports.

Here's the situation:

  • I have over 30 different types of reports, each with a different set of columns.

  • Reports can have thousands of rows.

  • Each report has its own generation logic, but they all get displayed in the same kind of table on the frontend: with column filters and pagination.

  • When a report is requested, I queue a background job to generate it.

  • Right now, once it’s done, I store the whole result as a giant JSON in Redis, and then load it into the frontend.

this works for small reports but causes OutOfMemory issues for large ones.

I need a generic solution to:

  • Store and query any kind of report.

  • Support frontend filters (per column) and pagination.

  • Handle millions of rows without killing memory.

  • Scale with many reports and many users.

Things I’ve already considered:

  • CSV in S3: great for exporting, but doesn’t help with filtered table views.

  • Embedded databases like DuckDB or H2: discarded due to memory + concurrency issues.

  • EAV (Entity-Attribute-Value): too painful for filtering and querying.

  • One table per report type: manageable for 2 or 3, but not with 30+ reports.

I'd really appreciate any suggestions. I've been going around in circles with this for days now.
